benchmark_details.name: DETONATE
benchmark_details.overview: DETONATE is a large-scale benchmark designed to stress-test alignment in text-to-image (T2I) models through fine-grained, adversarial evaluation. The dataset comprises approximately 100K curated image pairs across race, gender, and disability axes, sourced from hate speech datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance alignment in text-to-image generation models through a robust evaluation framework that accounts for social biases.

data.source: Hate speech datasets curated from publicly available sources, focusing on controversial social axes.
data.annotation: Human-verified preferences based on toxicity assessments and classification of images as hateful or non-hateful.

methodology.calculation: Based on clustering and geometric distance metrics to assess separability of aligned and misaligned representations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AQI values indicate better separation between safe and unsafe activations in the representation space.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluations reveal AQI scores and various statistical validations.
